reviews.review_title: Haunting and a little too real...
reviews.content: The film is set in a small, American town in the deep south. It's a small world with few people in rural areas where people often live in sheds and the garages...Billy Bob Thornton's performance as Carl is Oscar worthy. He completely disappears into the character as a humble complex man who cares deeply though burdened with frighteningly raw anger.Dwight Yoakam as Doyle is the most realistic violent drunk I've seen yet in a film. His performance is underrated.Lucas Black as Frank is also deeply underrated and underappreciated.The soundtrack that accompanies the movie creates an unsettling and occasionally lighthearted atmosphere. The use of silence and background noise have a chilling effect.

I only saw it once, but I plan to purchase a copy so that I may watch Sling Blade whenever I want; which will likely be fairly often as far as DVDs go.The movie was masterfully done; I just love that it's a film that involves no special effects or computer-aided graphics. It's all pure acting, and some of the best I've seen.Karl is one of the most believable, authentic characters I've seen, and it doesn't look like an easy role to pull off. He is perfectly portrayed, and mannerisms are realistic and consistent throughout the film.I won't throw in any spoilers here; I urge you to see this film if you haven't yet. I know I don't need to do the same to those who have seen it, because I'm certain they'll want to see it again. It is a fantastic movie, and I hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

reviews.review_title: Moving film and great acting... a little flawed plot
reviews.content: Concerned with some of the dark pits of the human soul, Sling Blade is an interesting and emotionally captivating movie to watch. It is a demonstration of how ill behaviour can cause violence to surge up in human relationships... At the same time, Sling Blade points out some socially sensitive truths about the rights of the mentally disabled, as well as the immaturity that (still) exists in our society, regarding how society views them.The viewer cannot help but feel attached to Karl, the mentally disabled protagonist of the story, within the first couple of minutes. Indeed, the acting is great, especially considering that the roles played are not typical ones.There are, however, some flaws in the plot... for example, I cannot believe that Doyle just sat there, pathetically reading his newspaper, waiting to get hit in the head by a lawnmower blade... Even for someone who disrespects and looks down his nose to "retards", I believe that he should have felt at least a bit threatened (this also contradicts his anxiety because of Karl's earlier nightly walk with a hammer). In addition, I just cannot accept that the boy, Frank, took orders from Doyle without resenting and only limited himself to throwing some angry looks. It just doesn't make sense... Also, I don't think that mentally ill people who have been treated and then released back into society would just live without any supervision...I can forgive, at least to some extent, the aforementioned mistakes, since the acting was so great and really convincing... Nevertheless, I don't think Sling Blade is going to stay with me for a long time... It was moving, emotionally intense, and thought-provoking, but it lacked impressiveness. All in all, I would encourage you to watch the movie if you enjoy the genre.

I really fell in love with Karl, his experiences remind you (well, smack you in the face) that good people can do bad things, and maybe the reasons behind cruel acts can make sense to good decent people. His friendship with Frank (Lucas Black) is charming and unusual, and almost instant. Lucas Black, as a young child, is unbelievable as an actor. I don't want to say too much. It has to be watched and felt.I sobbed like a baby. Please watch this film. It's both heartbreaking and heart warming. I couldn't turn away for a second.

reviews.review_title: Proof you don't need to do things big to do them right
reviews.content: Simple script. Simple shots. Basic. The product was greater than the sum of its parts. Cast is great and Dwight Yoakum is awesome. Ritter plays his part great - such a departure from what he's best known for. The background story leading into the story and Carl revisiting that story showing his arc is fantastic. The fact that Duvall and Walsh (two of my favorites. Walsh gone too soon should have been a bigger part in bigger movies) took such small roles shows the art that was intrinsic in this film. The final scene with Ritter was beyond sweet with Ritter's surprise of Karl's approval seeming so genuine. A wonderful film that, if it's on, I'm watching.

reviews.review_title: If you want to be amused don't watch this.
reviews.content: This is a brilliant film. It's a dark play full of irony that takes a deep look into the grimiest part of the human soul. There is symbolism in every scene, that captures your imagination and curiosity, leading you into the next scene until you know without a doubt how it must end. There is a little 'tongue in cheek' speckled throughout the film, just enough to make you laugh occasionally. You really need to pay attention to the characters' actions and words because everything is eventually connected.I'm not a big fan of Billy Bob Thorton, but he's impressive in this movie. He does such a magnificent job with his character, Karl, that you don't recognize him right away. Dwight Yokum is also fantastic. He really nails that incredibly spiteful personality that you wish someone would kill. I was a bit surprised by John Ritter's appearance as the gay friend; it was really unexpected, but so was Robert Duvall's bit part. Thorton has proved his abilities acting and directing, but of his entire career so far, this is his best work at both.

One of the mysteries of life is how this movie didn't achieve "one of the greatest" status with more people. It is incredibly gripping and moving, relying not on big-name stars or special effects, but fantastic writing and acting, not to mention characters that make you nod as you recognize like characters in your life. And Billy Bob hired Southern actors to play Southern characters, a fact for which I can't thank him enough. you need to see this movie.

reviews.review_title: One of the most unusual and enjoyable films I've ever seen
reviews.content: I suppose I was drawn to the movie because of a potential for violence.  I stayed because it was so incredibly interesting.  I think that Billy Bob Thornton is one of the greatest character actors there has ever been.  It never ceases to amaze me what kind of characters (believable characters) he can play.

reviews.review_title: Excellent character study, and a study in right versus wrong
reviews.content: Captivating.....a real turn-about in movie making.  Had this movie used the glitz and glitter that most Hollywood offerings avail themselves of, it would have flunked.  This was so close to real life, it's more like a home movie, but powerful.  Billy Bob, and his character Carl, gave an outstanding performance, and, more importantly, the movie tests the viewer's perspectives and beliefs on right and wrong, and relationships.  I found this movie challenging me to think about what I profess to believe in.  Be prepared to deal with this movie in a different way than just being entertained.

First of all I would like to comment that SLING BLADE in my opinion is among the most brilliant of films ever made, whom viewers possessing a more intellectual quality of mindset would likely appreciate.Previously I was hesitant to watch this movie based on its title SLING BLADE, thus leading myself to prejudge it based on an assumption that the movie was likely to be another mindless & bloody horror movie.I was very wrong ! Sling Blade help improve a flaw beheld in my personal character, again I learned another valuable lesson of life for my error of pre-judgement. Throughout the movie I was expecting at some point that 'ALL HELL' was going to break loose, but the movie never unleashed the nightmare violence I expected to happen at some point in the film. Instead I was to be treated to an excellent drama of a most special type, the contents of which for me were completely 'unpredictable'. All of the characters were excellently portrayed in a most 'relate-able' humanistic manner. After watching this movie again, I noticed my former philosophy of the lead character's psychological reasoning for his ending actions were perhaps much more complex than I originally thought.
Outstanding performance hats off to the actors and actresses in this movie.
